label: lake
definition: A body of water or other liquid of considerable size contained in a depression on a landmass.

label: river
definition: A stream which, through permanent or seasonal flow processes, moves from elevated land towards lower elevations through a definite channel and empties either into a sea, lake, or another river or ends on land as bed seepage and evapotranspiration exceed water supply.

label: stream
definition: A watercourse which is linear and flows across the solid portion of a planetary surface.

label: watercourse
definition: A flowing body of water.

label: water body
definition: An accumulation of water of varying size.

label: grassland area
definition: An area in which grasses (Graminae) are a significant component of the vegetation.

label: woodland area
definition: Land having a cover of trees, shrubs, or both.

label: forested area
definition: An area with a high density of trees. A small forest may be called a wood.

label: permafrost
definition: Soil or rock and included ice or organic material at or below the freezing point of water (0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees Fahrenheit) for two or more years.

label: bank
definition: The sloping margin of a watercourse, serving to confine it to its natural channel.

label: stream bank
definition: The sloping margin of a stream, serving to confine it to its natural channel.

label: river bank
definition: The sloping margin of a river, serving to confine it to its natural channel.

label: solid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of solid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: volcano
definition: An opening, or rupture, in the Earth's surface or crust, which allows hot, molten rock, ash and gases to escape from deep below the surface.

label: depression
definition: A landform sunken or depressed below the surrounding area.

label: channel of a watercourse
definition: The physical confine of a river, slough or ocean strait consisting of a bed and banks.

label: biome
definition: A biome is an ecosystem to which resident ecological communities have evolved adaptations.

label: terrestrial biome
definition: A biome which is  primarily or completely situated on a landmass.

label: submerged bed
definition: The portion of the ground surface which lies below water.

label: rock
definition: A rock is a naturally occurring solid aggregate of one or more minerals or mineraloids.

label: soil
definition: Soil is an environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.

label: slope
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the planetary surface between the peak of an elevation or the bottom of a depression and  relatively flat surrounding land.

label: air
definition: The mixture of gases (roughly (by molar content/volume: 78% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.038% carbon dioxide, trace amounts of other gases, and a variable amount (average around 1%) of water vapor) that surrounds the planet Earth.

label: liquid water
definition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

label: contaminated soil
definition: A portion of contaminated soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of some contaminant.

label: clay
definition: A group of hydrous aluminium phyllosilicate (phyllosilicates being a subgroup of silicate minerals) minerals (see clay minerals), that are typically less than 2 micrometres in diameter. Clay consists of a variety of phyllosilicate minerals rich in silicon and aluminium oxides and hydroxides which include variable amounts of structural water.

label: enriched soil
definition: A portion of enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of some material entity.

label: environmental material
definition: A portion of environmental material is a fiat object part which forms the medium or part of the medium of an environmental system.

label: surface layer
definition: A layer of some material entity which is adjacent to one or more of its external boundaries and directly interacts with its immediate surroundings.

label: aerosol
definition: Airborne solid particles (also called dust or particulate matter (PM)) or liquid droplets.

label: silt
definition: Silt is granular material of a size somewhere between sand and clay whose mineral origin is quartz and feldspar.

label: sand
definition: A naturally occurring granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles.

label: organic material
definition: Environmental material derived from living organisms and composed primarily of one or more biomacromolecules.

label: anthropogenic terrestrial biome
definition: An anthropogenic terrestrial biome is a terrestrial biome which has community structures determined by human activity.

label: lava
definition: Lava is a mixture of molten or semi-molten rock, volatiles, and solids which has extruded beyond a planetary crust.

label: dense settlement biome
definition: A dense settlement biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which is primarily used for human habitation, recreation, and industry within built structures with little other land use.

label: urban biome
definition: An urban biome is a dense settlement biome which has been urbanised.

label: environmental system
definition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.

label: mineral material
definition: A mineral material is an environmental material which is primarily composed of some substance that is naturally occurring, solid and stable at room temperature, representable by a chemical formula, usually abiogenic, and that has an ordered atomic structure.

label: water vapour
definition: Water vapour is a vapour which is the gas phase of water.

label: atmosphere
definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

label: water ice
definition: Ice is water frozen into a solid state. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter its appearance.

label: layer
definition: A layer is a quantity of some material which is spatially continuous, has comparable thickness, and usually covers some surface.

label: planetary surface
definition: A planetary surface is a surface layer where the solid or liquid material of a planet comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: vegetation layer
definition: A layer which is determined by a form of vegetation.

label: snow
definition: Snow is an environmental material which is primarily composed of flakes of crystalline water ice.

label: environmental zone
definition: A site which has its extent determined by the presence or influence of one or more components of an environmental system or the processes occurring therein.

label: lava flow
definition: A lava flow is a moving outpouring of lava, which is created during a non-explosive effusive eruption.

label: lotic water body
definition: A lotic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, is flowing.

label: volcanic eruption
definition: A volcanic eruption is a process during which lava, tephra (ash, lapilli, volcanic bombs and blocks), and assorted gases are expelled from a volcanic vent or fissure.

label: planetary landmass
definition: A landmass which is part of a planet.

label: outer space
definition: Outer space is a hard vacuum containing a low density of particles, predominantly a plasma of hydrogen and helium as well as electromagnetic radiation, magnetic fields, neutrinos, dust and cosmic rays that exists between celestial bodies.

label: planetary crust
definition: A planetary crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet or natural satellite, which is chemically distinct from the underlying mantle.

label: planetary structural layer
definition: A planetary structural layer is laminar part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density. Planetary layers have differing physicochemical properties and composition.

label: lithosphere
definition: A lithosphere is the outermost shell of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite that is defined by its rigid mechanical properties.

label: magma
definition: Magma is a mixture of molten or semi-molten rock, volatiles, and solids that is found beneath the uppermost solid layer of a planetary body. Besides molten rock, magma may also contain suspended crystals, dissolved gas and sometimes gas bubbles.

label: explosive eruption
definition: An explosive eruption is a volcanic process in which pressurised magma is violently expelled and froths into volcanic ash. Explosive eruptions can eject a cloud of rocks, dust, gas, and pyroclastic material  which may then collapse, creating a pyroclastic flow of hot volcanic matter.

label: effusive eruption
definition: An effusive eruption is a volcanic eruption during which lava flows onto the ground.

label: tephra
definition: Tephra is fragmental material produced by a volcanic eruption regardless of composition, fragment size or emplacement mechanism.

label: geological fracture
definition: A geological fracture is any separation in a geologic formation, such as a joint or a fault that divides a mass of rock into two or more pieces.

label: geological fault
definition: A geological fault is a planar fracture or discontinuity in a volume of rock, across which there has been significant displacement as a result of rock mass movement.

label: active geological fault
definition: An active fault is a fault that is likely to become the source of another earthquake sometime in the future. Geologists commonly consider faults to be active if there has been movement observed or evidence of seismic activity during the last 10,000 years.

label: earthquake
definition: An earthquake is a process during which energy is released in an astronomical body's crust, causing the displacement of crustal parts and the generation of seismic waves.

label: tectonic earthquake
definition: An earthquake caused by the sudden release of energy accumulated in an astronomical body's crust, as the elastic strain placed on constituent rock masses causes them to fracture.

label: megathrust earthquake
definition: A megathrust earthquake is a tectonic earthquake which occurs at subduction zones at destructive plate boundaries (convergent boundaries). These interplate earthquakes are the planet's most powerful, with moment magnitudes that can exceed 9.0.

label: polluted lake
definition: A lake which has concentrations of environmental contaminants high enough to harm the ecosystems associated with it.

label: water mass
definition: A mass of water.

label: coast
definition: A coast is the area where land meets the sea, ocean, or lake.

label: tsunami
definition: A tsunami is a process during which a series of waves is generated in a water body, typically an ocean or large lake, by the displacement of a large volume of water. Earthquakes, volcanic eruptions and other underwater explosions (including detonations of underwater nuclear devices), landslides, glacier calvings, meteorite impacts and other disturbances above or below water all have the potential to generate a tsunami.

label: mass wasting
definition: Mass wasting is the geomorphic process by which solid environmental material such as soil, sand, regolith, and/or rock move downslope typically as a mass, largely under the force of gravity, but frequently affected by water and water content as in submarine environments and mudslides.

label: avalanche
definition: A mass wasting flow during which snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: landslide process
definition: A landslide is a process whereby a large mass of earth and rocks moves down a hill or a mountainside.

label: geological subsidence
definition: A material transport process during which a geological surface shifts downward relative to a datum such as sea-level.

label: mass wasting flow
definition: A mass wasting flow is a form of mass wasting during which the moving materials behave similarly to a flowing fluid. Water, air and ice are often involved in enabling fluidlike motion of the material.

label: mudflow
definition: A mudflow is a form of mass wasting which involves very rapid to extremely rapid surging flow of debris that has become partially or fully liquified by the addition of significant amounts of water to clay-rich source material.

label: lahar
definition: A lahar is a type of mudflow or debris flow composed of a slurry of pyroclastic material, rocky debris, and water. The material flows down from a volcano, typically along a river valley.

label: volcanic ash
definition: Volcanic ash is an environmental material which consists of fragments of pulverized rock, minerals, and volcanic glass, created during volcanic eruptions and measuring less than 2 millimetres in diameter. Volcanic ash is formed during explosive volcanic eruptions, phreatomagmatic eruptions and during transport in pyroclastic density currents.

label: ash fall process
definition: An ash fall process is a process in which volcanic ash formed during an explosive volcanic eruption, phreatomagmatic eruption, or during material transport in pyroclastic density currents is pulled towards the planetary surface by gravity.

label: hydrological precipitation process
definition: Hydrological precipitation is a process during which any product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapour is pulled to the planetary surface by gravity.

label: coastal flooding
definition: Coastal flooding is a process in which normally dry, low-lying land near a coast is flooded by sea water.

label: riverine flooding
definition: Riverine flooding is a process in which the flow rate of river water exceeds the capacity of its channel, thus flooding neighbouring land. Bends and meanders in a river channel are particularly disposed to such flooding.

label: flash flooding
definition: Flash flooding is a process in which low-lying land is inundated with water for a short period of time and are usually the result of precipitation or a breach in the container of a water body.

label: flood
definition: An unusual accumulation of water above the ground caused by high tide, heavy rain, melting snow or rapid runoff from paved areas.

label: coastal flood
definition: A coastal flood is a flood which is formed as a result of large amounts of water from marine water bodies or large lakes being transported to usually dry land by displacement processes such as high winds or seismic activity.

label: riverine flood
definition: A riverine flood is a flood which is formed as a result of a river's flow rate exceeding the capacity of its channel.

label: flash flood
definition: A flash flood is a flood formed by the rapid flooding of geomorphic low-lying areas. It may be caused by heavy rain associated with a severe thunderstorm, hurricane, tropical storm, or meltwater from ice or snow flowing over ice sheets or snowfields. Flash floods may also occur after the collapse of a natural ice or debris dam, or a human structure such as a man-made dam. Flash floods are distinguished from a regular flood by a timescale of less than six hours.

label: storm surge
definition: A storm surge is a coastal flood which is caused by low-pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: meteotsunami
definition: A meteotsunami is a tsunami caused by atmospheric processes and differences in air pressure.

label: storm surge process
definition: A storm surge process is a coastal flooding process which is caused by low pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: areal flooding
definition: Areal flooding is a flooding process in which flat or low-lying areas become inundated with water due to water input exceeding infiltration, evaporation, or run off.

label: urban flooding
definition: Urban flooding is a flooding process in which land or property in a built environment, particularly in more densely populated areas, is inundated due to the rate of water input exceeding that of water drainage provided by the environment's drainage systems.

label: condensation process
definition: Condensation is a process during which a gas undergoes a phase transition into a liquid.

label: lava flow process
definition: A process in which a volume of lava emitted during an effusive eruption moves along a solid surface.

label: habitat
definition: An environmental system which can sustain and allow the growth of an ecological population.

label: cloud
definition: A cloud is a visible mass of aerosolised liquid droplets or frozen crystals suspended in an atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body.

label: fire
definition: A fire is a process whereby rapid and exothermic oxidation of a material through a combustion process releases heat, light, and other products.

label: wildfire
definition: A conflagration which is uncontrolled and combusts material in a vegetated area, be it rural or wild.

label: conflagration
definition: A fire which occurs in a large spatial area poses a risk to human life, animal life, health, and/or property.

label: flame
definition: A portion of gas which is emitted by a fire or other exothermic reaction, is of increased temperature, and typically emits light in the visible range.

label: hydrocarbon flame
definition: A flame which is produced by the combustion of hydrocarbon fuel.

label: forest fire
definition: A wildfire which occurs in a forest, primarily consuming vegetation as fuel.

label: mass gaseous flow
definition: A process whereby a large volume of gas moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: gaseous environmental material
definition: A material entity which is composed of one or more chemical entities and has neither independent shape nor volume but tends to expand indefinitely.

label: plasma
definition: A material entity which is composed of a volume of unbound positive and negative particles in roughly equal numbers, conducts electricity, and possesses internal magnetic fields.

label: astronomical body
definition: An object which is naturally occuring, bound together by gravitational or electromagnetic forces, and surrounded by space.

label: planet
definition: A planet is an astronomical body orbiting a star or stellar remnant that is massive enough to be rounded by its own gravity, is not massive enough to cause thermonuclear fusion, and has cleared its neighbouring region of planetesimals.

label: astronomical object
definition: An object which is composed of one or more gravitationally bound structures that are associated with a position in space.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: solid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a solid state.

label: liquid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a liquid state.

label: biosphere
definition: A biosphere is a part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the living entities within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body, as well as the non-living and dead entities with which they interact.

label: hydrosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: pedosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of soil, subject to soil formation processes, and found on the surface of a lithosphere.

label: humid air
definition: Air which has increased levels of water vapour.

label: water vapour saturated air
definition: Air which has a partial pressure of water vapour equal or near equal to its equilibrium vapor pressure at a given temperature.

label: water-based rainfall
definition: A hydrological precipitation process in which atmospheric water vapour condenses to form droplets of liquid water massive enough to fall to a planetary surface due to the planet's gravity.

label: droplet
definition: A droplet is a small column of liquid, bounded completely or almost completely by free surfaces which maintains its shape due to the surface tension of the liquid.

label: raindrop
definition: A droplet formed by condensation of vapour in an atmosphere and which is sufficiently massive to overcome atmospheric resistance and fall to a planetary surface due to gravity.

label: combustion process
definition: Combustion or burning is a high-temperature exothermic redox chemical reaction between a fuel and an oxidant that produces oxidized, often gaseous products, in a mixture termed as smoke.

label: thermolysis
definition: A chemical decomposition (the separation of a single chemical compound into its two or more elemental parts or to simpler compounds) caused by heat.

label: hailfall
definition: Hailfall is a hydrological process in which balls or irregular lumps of water ice formed in thunderstorm or cumulonimbus clouds fall to a planetary surface.

label: precipitation process
definition: A precipitation process is a process in which a portion of some substance segregates from a material in which that substance or its precursors were dissolved or suspended in and settles due to a force such as gravity or centrifugal force.

label: storm
definition: A storm is an environmental process in which an environmental system and the processes it participates in are strongly perturbed by external forcings. These forcings typically increase the rates of processes unfolding in the system, relative to their normal rates.

label: atmospheric storm
definition: An atmospheric storm is a process in which a portion of an astronomical body's atmosphere is strongly perturbed from its prevaling weather.

label: thunderstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm which occurs in cumulonimbus clouds and during which lightning and thunder occur.

label: rainstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which intense rainfall occurs.

label: hailstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm which intense hailfall occurs.

label: snowstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which intense snowfall occurs.

label: icestorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which freezing rain falls and accumulates as ice on exposed surfaces.

label: snowfall
definition: A hydrological process in which irregular aggregates of snow fall to a planetary surface.

label: freezing rainfall
definition: Rainfall which occurs when the temperature of a planetary surface and its surrounding atmosphere are below the freezing point of water, resulting in supercooled raindrops which freeze upon impact with solid surfaces.

label: electrostatic discharge process
definition: A process during which a sudden flow of electricity occurs, often accompanied by a visible release of photons, between two electrically charged objects due to contact, an electrical short, or dielectric breakdown.

label: atmospheric lightning
definition: A sudden electrostatic discharge which occurs during an electrical storm as differentially charged atmospheric entities equalise their charge.

label: intercloud lightning
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs between at least two clouds.

label: intracloud lightning
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs within a single cloud.

label: lightning strike
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs between a cloud and an object on a planetary surface, or a planetary surface itself.

label: lightning flash
definition: A lightning process during which electrostatic discharge occurs within a single cloud or between multiple clouds.

label: blizzard
definition: A blizzard is a severe snowstorm during which snowfall is transported by strong winds, sustained for several hours.

label: ground blizzard
definition: A ground blizzard is a storm during which snow which has settled on a planetary surface is resuspended in and transported through its atmosphere by strong winds, sustained for several hours.

label: rubbish landslide
definition: A mass wasting process during which refuse from human activities, usually accumulated at a dumping site, falls down a slope under the force of gravity.

label: mass liquid flow
definition: A process whereby a volume of liquid moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: water flow process
definition: A process during which a volume of water is transported due to a disequilibria in physical forces.

label: meteor
definition: A meteor is any matter- or energy-based entity which is located in the atmosphere of an astronomical body.

label: radiation
definition: A process during which energy is emitted or transmitted in the form of waves or particles through space or a material medium.

label: particle radiation
definition: A radiation process during which energy is transmitted or emitted by means of fast-moving subatomic particles.

label: particle beam radiation
definition: A particle radiation process during which subatomic particles move in the same direction.

label: electromagnetic radiation
definition: A radiation process during which waves (or their quanta, photons) of the electromagnetic field propagate (radiate) through space carrying electromagnetic energy.

label: tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move.

label: convergent tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move towards one another.

label: tectonic plate
definition: A part of a lithosphere which is separated by other such parts by geographic faults or similar geomorphological discontinuities.

label: tectonic plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates move towards, away from, or along one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere.

label: convergent plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates are actively moving towards one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere that forces one plate below the other where it melts in the mantle.

label: tectonic plate subduction
definition: A convergent tectonic movement process during which one plate moves under another and is forced or sinks due to gravity into a mantle.

label: rockslide process
definition: A rockslide is a process whereby a large mass of rock moves down a hill or a mountainside.

label: ecosystem
definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

label: ice
definition: An ice is an environmental material which is either frozen or which is maintained in a solid state by gravitational forces or pressure.

label: geodiversity
definition: A quality which inheres in a astronomical body or astronomical body part by virtue of the variation in its material composition, participation in geological processes, and the variation in is land- and hydroforms.

label: terrestrial environmental zone
definition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a land mass or the atmosphere or space adjacent to it.

label: grassland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which grasses (Graminae) are the dominant form of vegetation and determine the system's structure and dynamics.

label: stellar radiation
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star.

label: ultraviolet stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a star at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

label: X-ray stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted by high-energy electrons as they fall into a lower state of energy.

label: gamma-ray stellar radiation
definition: A stellar radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted from the radioactive decay (gamma decay) of atomic nuclei.

label: canopy
definition: A vegetation layer which is formed by a collection of individual plant crowns, themselves constituting part of the aboveground portion of a plant community.

label: forest ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities form continuous or discontinuous regions of canopy cover.

label: industrial fire
definition: A fire which occurs in an industrial area or building.

label: brush fire
definition: A land fire which consumes low-growing plants such as scrub and brush.

label: bush fire
definition: A land fire which occurs in a large uncleared or sparsely settled area (as in Australia) usually scrub-covered or forested.

label: pasture fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a pastureland.

label: land fire
definition: A fire which occurs on land, typically consuming a terrestrial ecosystem as fuel.

label: convective storm
definition: An atmospheric storm which is generated by the heating and convection of moist and unstable air masses.

label: extra-tropical cyclone
definition: A warm-core cyclone which occurs in the middle and high latitudes, primarily drawing energy from horizontal temperature contrasts between atmospheric fronts.

label: tropical storm
definition: A an atmospheric storm which originates over tropical or subtropical waters and possesses a warm-core, non-frontal synoptic-scale cyclone with a low pressure centre, spiral rain bands and strong winds.

label: cyclone
definition: An atmospheric storm during which a large mass of atmospheric gas rotates around a centre of low atmospheric pressure, generating high winds which spiral towards that centre.

label: warm core cyclone
definition: A cyclone which rotates around an area low atmospheric pressure with increased temperature.

label: vegetated area
definition: A vegetated area is a geographic feature which has ground cover dominated by plant communities.

label: solid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of solid environmental material.

label: advective transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a volume of material is displaced due to a disequilibrium in physical forces and during which 1) the qualities that inhere in that volume and 2) the processes that are unfolding within it are largely unchanged.

label: liquid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid or gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer where the solid or liquid material of an astronomical body comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: radiation from a manufactured product
definition: An electromagnetic radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted from a manufactured product.

label: material congelation process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material's viscosity increase either through a reduction in temperature, through chemical reactions, or other physical effects.

label: fluid layer
definition: A layer which is composed primarily of some fluid.

label: interface layer
definition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

label: mass of environmental material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of an environmental material

label: mass of fluid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a fluid.

label: mass of liquid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a liquid.

label: cyclonic circulation
definition: A mass fluid flow which moves  in the same direction as a planet's rotation, rotating due to a Coriolis effect.

label: structural collapse process
definition: A process during which the ability of a material entity to maintain its internal organisation fails, resulting in deformation and a breakdown of that organisation.

label: landmass
definition: A large continuous area of land, either surrounded by sea or contiguous with another landmass.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in varying quantities.

label: land
definition: A surface layer of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material and is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

label: energy transfer process
definition: A process during which one entity loses energy to another entity.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: A liquid or a gas.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: flooding
definition: A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from the overflow of inland and/or tidal waters, and/or the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source. A great flow along a watercourse or a flow causing inundation of lands not normally covered by water.

label: environmental pollution
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: air pollution
definition: A pollution process during which particulates or other contaminants are released into a portion of air.

label: soil pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into soil.

label: water pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into water.

label: plastic pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: urban pollution
definition: A pollution process that results in increased levels of pollutants in an urban environment.

label: material accumulation process
definition: A process during which the mass of one or more materials, present within a given site, increases.

label: material transport process
definition: A process during which material is displaced from its original location and transported either to a new location or back to the original location.

label: material decumulation process
definition: A process during which a mass composed of one or more environmental materials, present within a given site, decreases.

label: aeolian transport process
definition: A material transport process during which one or more environmental materials are transported by the action of wind.

label: powdery snow
definition: Uncompacted snow containing trapped atmospheric gases.

label: material transformation process
definition: A process during which a portion of some environmental material is converted into a different material or a collection of materials.

label: explosion process
definition: A process during which a material entity undergoes a rapid increase in volume, releasing gasses and various forms of energy, often including thermal, light and sound energy.

label: permafrost methane explosion
definition: An explosion during which methane-rich gas trapped in permafrost combusts.

label: aeolian transport of snow
definition: An aeolian transport process during which powdery snow is displaced and moved.

label: slab avalanche
definition: A mass wasting process during which slab snow rapidly moves down a sloping surface.

label: powdery snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which powdery snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: wet snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which a suspension of water and snow flows down a sloping surface.

label: grass fire
definition: A fire which occurs in a grassland, combusting biomass stored in grasses as its primary fuel.

label: drought
definition: A hydrological precipitation process with a reduced rate relative to some historical average, typically resulting in ecosystemic perturbations.

label: ultraviolet radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted at wavelengths between 10 nm and 400 nm.

label: X-ray radiation
definition: A radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted by high-energy electrons as they fall into a lower state of energy.

label: gamma-ray radiation
definition: A radiation process during which penetrating electromagnetic radiation is emitted from the radioactive decay (gamma decay) of atomic nuclei.

label: ionizing radiation
definition: A radiation process during which electromagnetic waves or their quanta are emitted with sufficient energy to disrupt molecular bonds or alter the electron number of atoms.
